column1: 3B5BCC36-166B-4570-9022-31120179DF2E#appfire#AA399770-F134-4D63-8400-B21774ABB5C3#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-28 14:38:10.0#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-28 14:38:10.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#B6D3E9B7-A148-46CB-BBE4-E11840F9F90A#appfire#AA399770-F134-4D63-8400-B21774ABB5C3#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-28 14:38:10.0#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-28 14:38:10.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#FC6A6EA5-CF2F-4345-A2C9-44ED84AABD57#appfire#AA399770-F134-4D63-8400-B21774ABB5C3#appfire#alarm.volume#appfire#100000#appfire##appfire#Alarm Volume#appfire#1#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-28 14:38:10.0#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-28 14:38:10.0#appfire#1
